Document scope

This procedure must be read by all employees of the Community Kitchen. It is available to volunteers for information and guidance. All storage activities and checks must be recorded in the Storage & Cleaning Checks app.

Responsibility & escalation

Cooks are responsible for all storage activities and checks, with support from volunteers. Any issue must be recorded in the app and the Kitchen Manager or Operations Manager must be notified immediately.

Discard rule (applies to ALL areas)

Expired, undated (when required), mouldy, spoiled, pest-damaged, leaking or swollen items → discard immediately.

Fridges (0–7 °C)

Allowed fridges Not allowed
  • Dairy products
  • Leftovers (sealed)
  • Cut vegetables (sealed)
  • Opened jars, sauces, pastes
  • Eggs: staff fridge only, original carton
  • Raw meat or raw fish
  • Hot or warm food
  • Undated items

Fridge stickers

Required for leftovers, cut vegetables, opened dairy and jars. Sticker shows product name and date:

  • Leftovers / cut veg: produced date (max 48h).
  • Dairy / jars: opened date.

Freezers (≤ –12 °C)

Allowed freezers Not allowed
  • Purchased frozen vegetables
  • Purchased frozen animal protein
  • Food cooked on site and frozen
  • Cut vegetables frozen by staff
  • Warm or partially thawed food
  • Damaged or leaking packaging

Freezer stickers (only when required)

  • Required only for leftovers or cut vegetables frozen by staff (product name + freezing date).
  • Not required for purchased frozen products.
  • FIFO respected.

Fresh vegetables (not cut)

Allowed Not allowed
  • Stored in clean crates or containers
  • Off the floor
  • Kept dry
  • FIFO respected
  • Stored directly on the floor
  • Stored under sinks
  • Mouldy or spoiled vegetables

Dry food / pantry

Allowed Not allowed
  • Unopened dry goods (rice, pasta, lentils, flour, cereal)
  • Unopened cans and jars
  • Unopened spices and condiments

Rules: keep dry; store off the floor; FIFO; packaging intact
  • Open bags without closing / sealing
  • Wet / damp packaging
  • Food stored on the floor
  • Food stored under sinks or near cleaning products
  • Pest signs (droppings, gnaw marks, insects)

Storage hygiene — all areas

  • Shelves and seals clean.
  • Containers clean before use.
  • Crates clean and dry.
  • No food under sinks, near cleaning products, or on the floor.
  • No damaged or leaking packaging.

Pest check — visual (AM & PM)

Check for insects, droppings, gnaw marks, pest-damaged packaging. Any sign → record in app and notify Kitchen Manager or Operations Manager immediately.

Temperature deviation

  • Notify Kitchen Manager or Operations Manager immediately.
  • Keep door closed.
  • Move food if needed.
  • If food safety is uncertain → discard.
  • Record incident in app.
